name: around
posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

dsense.name: around
dsense.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: in a position or direction surrounding, or in a direction going along the edge of or from one part to another (of)
trans_examp.trans_cn: 四处，周围；围绕，（环）绕；掉转

example.eg: We sat around the table.
example.egtrans: 我们围着桌子坐着。

example.eg: He put his arm around her.
example.egtrans: 他用胳膊搂着她。

example.eg: A crowd had gathered around the scene of the accident.
example.egtrans: 事故现场围了一群人。

example.eg: She had a scarf around her neck.
example.egtrans: 她脖子上围了一条围巾。

example.eg: The moon goes around the earth.
example.egtrans: 月亮围绕地球转。

example.eg: I walked around the side of the building.
example.egtrans: 我从楼的一侧绕了过去。

example.eg: As the bus left, she turned around (= so that she was facing in the opposite direction) and waved goodbye to us.
example.egtrans: 公共汽车开动时，她转过身来向我们挥手告别。

example.eg: He put the wheel on the right/wrong way around (= facing the right/wrong way).
example.egtrans: 他把轮子装对了／安反了。

example.eg: The children were dancing around the room.
example.egtrans: 孩子们在房间里来回跳舞。

example.eg: I spent a year travelling around Africa and Asia.
example.egtrans: 我用了一年时间周游了非洲和亚洲。

example.eg: The museum's collection includes works of art from all around the world.
example.egtrans: 这个博物馆的馆藏包括来自世界各地的艺术品。

example.eg: She passed a plate of biscuits around (= from one person to another).
example.egtrans: 她端出一盘饼干让大家传着分享。

example.eg: This virus has been going around (= from one person to another).
example.egtrans: 这种病毒已经传播开来。

dsense.name: around
dsense.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: positioned or moving in or near a place, often without a clear direction, purpose, or order
trans_examp.trans_cn: （在…）附近，在（…）近处；到处，四处；随便

example.eg: He always leaves his clothes lying around (on the floor).
example.egtrans: 他总是随手把衣服（往地板上）一扔。

example.eg: She went into town and spent two hours just walking around.
example.egtrans: 她进了城，四处转悠了两个小时。

example.eg: Let's take the children to the park so they can run around for a while.
example.egtrans: 我们把孩子们带到公园去让他们到处跑跑吧。

example.eg: I used to live around (= near) here.
example.egtrans: 过去我就住在这一带。

example.eg: She's never around (= near here) when you need her.
example.egtrans: 你用得着她的时候，她就没影了。

example.eg: Will you be around next week?
example.egtrans: 你下周在吗？

example.eg: There's a lot of flu around (= a lot of people have it) at the moment.
example.egtrans: 现在流感肆虐。

example.eg: Smartphones have been around (= existed) for quite a while.
example.egtrans: 智能手机问世已经有一段时间了。

name: around
posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

dsense.name: around
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

example.eg: around six feet tall
example.egtrans: 大约6英尺高

example.eg: around two months ago
example.egtrans: 大约两个月前

example.eg: around four o'clock
example.egtrans: 4点左右

example.eg: She earns around $40,000 a year.
example.egtrans: 她一年大约挣4万美元。
